message:
Ortholion! How much is your life worth? How many people?

Prove the honor of your glorious land. Come face me alone! No guards, no witnesses.

[Ehrenfest leaps unnaturally high, passing above you, and disappears in the blink of an eye]

If only you were stronger...Maybe I could convince you to join us, [cough] but I have to admit my plan was blaming you for Ortholion's death.

You know, we're tired of you asking questions here and there, [cough] [cough].
Don't look at me that way, kid...[laughs]. This is too complicated for a young mind.

I'm... [stares at you] 

$playername! It's time to end with all of this!

replies.text: Right! Ortholion must pay for killing innocent people from Prim!

message:
[The general effortlessly subdues you, and begins to laugh] 

Look, take this signet. With this, my soldiers stationed outside the mining tunnel entrance will believe your words. Tell them I went to the Elm mine.

replies.text: OK, OK. I will but please don't hurt me anymore.

message: [Laughs quietly] Only simple minds would see things as black or white. Whether I believe or not, people do, and we in Feygard keep that in mind.

replies.text: OK. Now that you're aware of the situation, I'd better leave.
What about "I don't have time to..."?

message:
[People from the tavern start looking at the place where Ortholion and Ehrenfest are about to have a fight]

[looks around] No...Not yet. Argh! You kid, betrayer! You are about to discover how wrongly you have chosen!
[unsheathes his sword] Well, enough talk. I won't ignore your threats, evil creature.

replies.text: Ehrenfest, you have many things to explain!
[Shows the signet] Your general has gone to Elm mine. He could be in trouble.

message: [shouts] Hey, slackers! You're moving now. It's an order. Prepare yourselves, we are going to the Elm mine, our general needs us!
Yeah, sure. We are here posted by command of General Orhtolion of Feygard. You have no business here.

replies.text: [shows the signet] Yeah, sure. Now hurry up! Your general is waiting for you in the Elm mine.
